===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=たいにちにょらい'}} {{m|ltc|大日如來|tr={{IPAchar|/dajH njit njo loj/}}}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} traditional {{m|cmn|大日如來}} and simplified {{m|cmn|大日如来|tr=Dà rì rú lái}}.

{{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=たいにちにょらい'}} {{m|ltc|大日如來}} is a compound of {{m|ltc|大日}} + {{m|ltc|如來}}, where {{m|ltc|大日|lit=great sun}} is a translation of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=たいにちにょらい'}} {{m|sa|महावैरोचन|tr=Mahāvairocana|pos=the name of this Buddhist entity}}<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>, and {{m|ltc|如來}} is an abbreviation of either {{m|ltc|如去如來}} or {{m|ltc|如來如去||coming from suchness, going back into suchness}}, translations of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=たいにちにょらい'}} {{m|sa|तथागत|tr=tathāgata||coming from suchness, going back into suchness; thus coming, thus going|pos=exact meaning uncertain, see {{pedia|Tathāgata}}}}<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>.

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|だいにち にょらい}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=たいにちにょらい'|religion|Buddhism}} [[Dainichi Nyorai]]: the [[sun]] [[Buddha]], called [[Vairocana]] or [[Mahāvairocana]]; the [[embodiment]] of the Buddhist concept of [[emptiness]] or [[sunyata]], one of the Five Dhyani Buddhas, and an important entity in [[Shingon]] Buddhism
